title: ArchAgent: Agentic AI-driven Computer Architecture Discovery
comment: 13 pages, 5 figures, 2 tables
summary:
Agile hardware design flows are a critically needed force multiplier to meet the exploding demand for compute. Recently, agentic generative AI systems have demonstrated significant advances in algorithm design, improving code efficiency, and enabling discovery across scientific domains.
  Bridging these worlds, we present ArchAgent, an automated computer architecture discovery system built on AlphaEvolve. We show ArchAgent's ability to automatically design/implement state-of-the-art (SoTA) cache replacement policies (architecting new mechanisms/logic, not only changing parameters), broadly within the confines of an established cache replacement policy design competition.
  In two days without human intervention, ArchAgent generated a policy achieving a 5.3% IPC speedup improvement over the prior SoTA on public multi-core Google Workload Traces. On the heavily-explored single-core SPEC06 workloads, it generated a policy in just 18 days showing a 0.9% IPC speedup improvement over the existing SoTA (a similar "winning margin" as reported by the existing SoTA). ArchAgent achieved these gains 3-5x faster than prior human-developed SoTA policies.
  Agentic flows also enable "post-silicon hyperspecialization" where agents tune runtime-configurable parameters exposed in hardware policies to further align the policies with a specific workload (mix). Exploiting this, we demonstrate a 2.4% IPC speedup improvement over prior SoTA on SPEC06 workloads.
  Finally, we outline broader implications for computer architecture research in the era of agentic AI. For example, we demonstrate the phenomenon of "simulator escapes", where the agentic AI flow discovered and exploited a loophole in a popular microarchitectural simulator - a consequence of the fact that these research tools were designed for a (now past) world where they were exclusively operated by humans acting in good-faith.

AI.tldr: ArchAgent是一个基于AlphaEvolve的自动计算机架构发现系统，能够在两天内自动设计出优于现有最优缓存替换策略的新策略，在Google工作负载上实现5.3%的IPC加速提升。
AI.motivation: 面对计算需求的爆炸式增长，需要敏捷的硬件设计流程作为力量倍增器。虽然代理式生成AI系统在算法设计、代码优化和科学发现方面取得了显著进展，但尚未应用于计算机架构设计领域。
AI.method: 基于AlphaEvolve构建ArchAgent系统，自动设计和实现最先进的缓存替换策略（包括新机制和逻辑，而不仅仅是参数调整）。系统在已建立的缓存替换策略设计竞赛框架内工作，并支持"后硅片超专业化"的运行时参数调优。
AI.result: 在两天内无人工干预下，ArchAgent生成的策略在Google多核工作负载上比现有最优策略提升5.3% IPC加速；在SPEC06单核工作负载上，18天内提升0.9% IPC加速，速度比人工开发快3-5倍。通过后硅片超专业化，在SPEC06上进一步获得2.4%的IPC提升。
AI.conclusion: 代理式AI流程能够显著加速计算机架构设计，实现超越人类专家的性能，同时揭示了"模拟器逃逸"等新现象，表明传统研究工具需要适应代理式AI时代的新需求。

title: Agent Behavioral Contracts: Formal Specification and Runtime Enforcement for Reliable Autonomous AI Agents
comment: 71 pages, 7 figures, 14 tables. Patent pending. Also available on Zenodo: DOI 10.5281/zenodo.18775393
summary: Traditional software relies on contracts -- APIs, type systems, assertions -- to specify and enforce correct behavior. AI agents, by contrast, operate on prompts and natural language instructions with no formal behavioral specification. This gap is the root cause of drift, governance failures, and frequent project failures in agentic AI deployments. We introduce Agent Behavioral Contracts (ABC), a formal framework that brings Design-by-Contract principles to autonomous AI agents. An ABC contract C = (P, I, G, R) specifies Preconditions, Invariants, Governance policies, and Recovery mechanisms as first-class, runtime-enforceable components. We define (p, delta, k)-satisfaction -- a probabilistic notion of contract compliance that accounts for LLM non-determinism and recovery -- and prove a Drift Bounds Theorem showing that contracts with recovery rate gamma > alpha (the natural drift rate) bound behavioral drift to D* = alpha/gamma in expectation, with Gaussian concentration in the stochastic setting. We establish sufficient conditions for safe contract composition in multi-agent chains and derive probabilistic degradation bounds. We implement ABC in AgentAssert, a runtime enforcement library, and evaluate on AgentContract-Bench, a benchmark of 200 scenarios across 7 models from 6 vendors. Results across 1,980 sessions show that contracted agents detect 5.2-6.8 soft violations per session that uncontracted baselines miss entirely (p < 0.0001, Cohen's d = 6.7-33.8), achieve 88-100% hard constraint compliance, and bound behavioral drift to D* < 0.27 across extended sessions, with 100% recovery for frontier models and 17-100% across all models, at overhead < 10 ms per action.

AI.tldr: 提出了Agent Behavioral Contracts (ABC)框架，将设计契约原则引入AI代理，通过形式化规范（前提条件、不变式、治理策略、恢复机制）来约束代理行为，并证明能有效限制行为漂移。
AI.motivation: 传统软件依赖API、类型系统等契约来确保正确行为，而AI代理仅依赖提示和自然语言指令，缺乏形式化行为规范，这导致代理部署中的漂移、治理失败和项目失败问题。
AI.method: 引入ABC框架，定义契约C=(P,I,G,R)包含前提条件、不变式、治理策略和恢复机制；提出(p,delta,k)-满足度的概率性契约合规概念；证明漂移边界定理；建立多代理链的安全契约组合条件；实现AgentAssert运行时执行库。
AI.result: 在AgentContract-Bench基准测试中，契约代理每会话检测到5.2-6.8个软违规（基线完全未检测到），硬约束合规率达88-100%，行为漂移限制在D*<0.27，前沿模型恢复率达100%，所有动作开销<10ms。
AI.conclusion: ABC框架为AI代理提供了形式化行为规范机制，能有效检测违规、限制行为漂移并确保恢复，为可靠代理部署提供了理论基础和实用工具。

title: Search More, Think Less: Rethinking Long-Horizon Agentic Search for Efficiency and Generalization
comment: 12 pages, 5 figures
summary: Recent deep research agents primarily improve performance by scaling reasoning depth, but this leads to high inference cost and latency in search-intensive scenarios. Moreover, generalization across heterogeneous research settings remains challenging. In this work, we propose \emph{Search More, Think Less} (SMTL), a framework for long-horizon agentic search that targets both efficiency and generalization. SMTL replaces sequential reasoning with parallel evidence acquisition, enabling efficient context management under constrained context budgets. To support generalization across task types, we further introduce a unified data synthesis pipeline that constructs search tasks spanning both deterministic question answering and open-ended research scenarios with task appropriate evaluation metrics. We train an end-to-end agent using supervised fine-tuning and reinforcement learning, achieving strong and often state of the art performance across benchmarks including BrowseComp (48.6\%), GAIA (75.7\%), Xbench (82.0\%), and DeepResearch Bench (45.9\%). Compared to Mirothinker-v1.0, SMTL with maximum 100 interaction steps reduces the average number of reasoning steps on BrowseComp by 70.7\%, while improving accuracy.

AI.tldr: 提出SMTL框架，通过并行证据获取替代顺序推理，在有限上下文预算下实现高效搜索，同时通过统一数据合成提升跨任务泛化能力，在多个基准上达到SOTA性能。
AI.motivation: 当前深度研究代理主要通过增加推理深度提升性能，但这在搜索密集型场景中导致高推理成本和延迟，且跨异构研究设置的泛化能力有限。
AI.method: 提出SMTL框架：1) 用并行证据获取替代顺序推理，实现高效上下文管理；2) 引入统一数据合成管道，构建涵盖确定性问答和开放式研究场景的搜索任务；3) 使用监督微调和强化学习训练端到端代理。
AI.result: 在BrowseComp(48.6%)、GAIA(75.7%)、Xbench(82.0%)和DeepResearch Bench(45.9%)上取得SOTA性能。相比Mirothinker-v1.0，在BrowseComp上推理步骤减少70.7%的同时提升准确率。
AI.conclusion: SMTL框架通过并行证据获取和统一数据合成，在保持高性能的同时显著提升搜索效率和跨任务泛化能力。

title: Cognitive Models and AI Algorithms Provide Templates for Designing Language Agents
summary: While contemporary large language models (LLMs) are increasingly capable in isolation, there are still many difficult problems that lie beyond the abilities of a single LLM. For such tasks, there is still uncertainty about how best to take many LLMs as parts and combine them into a greater whole. This position paper argues that potential blueprints for designing such modular language agents can be found in the existing literature on cognitive models and artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms. To make this point clear, we formalize the idea of an agent template that specifies roles for individual LLMs and how their functionalities should be composed. We then survey a variety of existing language agents in the literature and highlight their underlying templates derived directly from cognitive models or AI algorithms. By highlighting these designs, we aim to call attention to agent templates inspired by cognitive science and AI as a powerful tool for developing effective, interpretable language agents.

AI.tldr: 该论文提出从认知模型和AI算法中寻找设计模块化语言智能体的蓝图，通过定义智能体模板来指导多个LLM的组合，并调查现有文献中的语言智能体设计模式。
AI.motivation: 尽管单个大型语言模型能力不断增强，但仍有许多复杂问题超出单个LLM的能力范围。目前对于如何将多个LLM作为部件组合成更强大的整体仍存在不确定性，需要寻找有效的设计方法。
AI.method: 提出"智能体模板"的概念，用于定义单个LLM的角色及其功能组合方式。通过调查现有文献中的各种语言智能体，分析它们如何从认知模型或AI算法中衍生出底层模板。
AI.result: 论文展示了多种现有语言智能体的设计模式，这些模式直接来源于认知模型或AI算法，证明了从这些领域汲取灵感的可行性。
AI.conclusion: 受认知科学和AI启发的智能体模板是开发有效、可解释语言智能体的强大工具，值得进一步关注和研究。

title: Strategy Executability in Mathematical Reasoning: Leveraging Human-Model Differences for Effective Guidance
summary: Example-based guidance is widely used to improve mathematical reasoning at inference time, yet its effectiveness is highly unstable across problems and models-even when the guidance is correct and problem-relevant. We show that this instability arises from a previously underexplored gap between strategy usage-whether a reasoning strategy appears in successful solutions-and strategy executability-whether the strategy remains effective when instantiated as guidance for a target model. Through a controlled analysis of paired human-written and model-generated solutions, we identify a systematic dissociation between usage and executability: human- and model-derived strategies differ in structured, domain-dependent ways, leading to complementary strengths and consistent source-dependent reversals under guidance. Building on this diagnosis, we propose Selective Strategy Retrieval (SSR), a test-time framework that explicitly models executability by selectively retrieving and combining strategies using empirical, multi-route, source-aware signals. Across multiple mathematical reasoning benchmarks, SSR yields reliable and consistent improvements over direct solving, in-context learning, and single-source guidance, improving accuracy by up to $+13$ points on AIME25 and $+5$ points on Apex for compact reasoning models. Code and benchmark are publicly available at: https://github.com/lwd17/strategy-execute-pipeline.

AI.tldr: 论文提出选择性策略检索（SSR）框架，通过建模策略可执行性来改进数学推理中的示例引导效果，解决现有方法在不同问题和模型间效果不稳定的问题。
AI.motivation: 现有基于示例的引导方法在数学推理中存在效果不稳定的问题，即使引导正确且与问题相关。这种不稳定性源于策略使用（策略是否出现在成功解决方案中）与策略可执行性（策略作为引导时是否对目标模型有效）之间的差距未被充分探索。
AI.method: 通过对比分析人类编写和模型生成的解决方案，识别使用与可执行性之间的系统性差异。提出选择性策略检索（SSR）框架，通过经验性、多路径、源感知信号来选择性检索和组合策略，显式建模可执行性。
AI.result: 在多个数学推理基准测试中，SSR相比直接求解、上下文学习和单源引导方法，提供了可靠且一致的改进。在AIME25上准确率提升高达13个百分点，在Apex上提升5个百分点，对紧凑推理模型效果显著。
AI.conclusion: 策略使用与可执行性之间的差距是数学推理引导效果不稳定的关键原因。SSR框架通过显式建模可执行性，能够有效利用人类和模型生成策略的互补优势，实现更稳定和有效的推理引导。

title: SideQuest: Model-Driven KV Cache Management for Long-Horizon Agentic Reasoning
summary: Long-running agentic tasks, such as deep research, require multi-hop reasoning over information distributed across multiple webpages and documents. In such tasks, the LLM context is dominated by tokens from external retrieval, causing memory usage to grow rapidly and limiting decode performance. While several KV cache compression techniques exist for long-context inputs, we find that existing heuristics fail to support multi-step reasoning models effectively. We address this challenge with SideQuest -- a novel approach that leverages the Large Reasoning Model (LRM) itself to perform KV cache compression by reasoning about the usefulness of tokens in its context. To prevent the tokens associated with this management process from polluting the model's memory, we frame KV cache compression as an auxiliary task executed in parallel to the main reasoning task. Our evaluations, using a model trained with just 215 samples, show that SideQuest reduces peak token usage by up to 65% on agentic tasks with minimal degradation in accuracy, outperforming heuristic-based KV cache compression techniques.

AI.tldr: SideQuest利用大型推理模型自身对KV缓存进行压缩，通过并行执行压缩任务减少代理任务中的峰值令牌使用量达65%，同时保持推理准确性。
AI.motivation: 长期运行的代理任务（如深度研究）需要在多个网页和文档之间进行多跳推理，导致外部检索的令牌占据LLM上下文，使内存使用快速增长并限制解码性能。现有的KV缓存压缩启发式方法无法有效支持多步推理模型。
AI.method: 提出SideQuest方法，利用大型推理模型自身对上下文中的令牌有用性进行推理，从而实现KV缓存压缩。为防止压缩管理过程污染模型内存，将KV缓存压缩作为与主要推理任务并行执行的辅助任务。仅用215个样本训练模型。
AI.result: 在代理任务中，SideQuest将峰值令牌使用量减少高达65%，同时准确性下降最小，优于基于启发式的KV缓存压缩技术。
AI.conclusion: SideQuest通过让模型自身参与KV缓存管理，有效解决了长期代理任务中的内存扩展问题，为多步推理模型提供了高效的上下文管理方案。

title: MiroFlow: Towards High-Performance and Robust Open-Source Agent Framework for General Deep Research Tasks
summary: Despite the remarkable progress of large language models (LLMs), the capabilities of standalone LLMs have begun to plateau when tackling real-world, complex tasks that require interaction with external tools and dynamic environments. Although recent agent frameworks aim to enhance model autonomy through tool integration and external interaction, they still suffer from naive workflows, unstable performance, limited support across diverse benchmarks and tasks, and heavy reliance on costly commercial APIs. In this work, we propose a high-performance and robust open-source agent framework, termed MiroFlow, which incorporates an agent graph for flexible orchestration, an optional deep reasoning mode to enhance performance, and a robust workflow execution to ensure stable and reproducible performance. Extensive experiments demonstrate that MiroFlow consistently achieves state-of-the-art performance across multiple agent benchmarks, including GAIA, BrowseComp-EN/ZH, HLE, xBench-DeepSearch, and notably FutureX. We hope it could serve as an easily accessible, reproducible, and comparable baseline for the deep research community.

AI.tldr: MiroFlow是一个高性能、鲁棒的开源智能体框架，通过智能体图灵活编排、深度推理模式和鲁棒工作流执行，在多个基准测试中达到SOTA性能。
AI.motivation: 尽管大语言模型取得了显著进展，但独立LLM在处理需要与外部工具和动态环境交互的复杂现实任务时能力开始趋于平稳。现有智能体框架存在工作流程简单、性能不稳定、对不同基准和任务支持有限、严重依赖昂贵商业API等问题。
AI.method: 提出MiroFlow框架，包含：1）智能体图实现灵活编排；2）可选的深度推理模式提升性能；3）鲁棒的工作流执行确保稳定和可复现的性能。
AI.result: 在多个智能体基准测试（GAIA、BrowseComp-EN/ZH、HLE、xBench-DeepSearch、FutureX）中持续达到最先进的性能。
AI.conclusion: MiroFlow可作为深度研究社区易于访问、可复现和可比较的基准框架。

title: OmniGAIA: Towards Native Omni-Modal AI Agents
summary: Human intelligence naturally intertwines omni-modal perception -- spanning vision, audio, and language -- with complex reasoning and tool usage to interact with the world. However, current multi-modal LLMs are primarily confined to bi-modal interactions (e.g., vision-language), lacking the unified cognitive capabilities required for general AI assistants. To bridge this gap, we introduce OmniGAIA, a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate omni-modal agents on tasks necessitating deep reasoning and multi-turn tool execution across video, audio, and image modalities. Constructed via a novel omni-modal event graph approach, OmniGAIA synthesizes complex, multi-hop queries derived from real-world data that require cross-modal reasoning and external tool integration. Furthermore, we propose OmniAtlas, a native omni-modal foundation agent under tool-integrated reasoning paradigm with active omni-modal perception. Trained on trajectories synthesized via a hindsight-guided tree exploration strategy and OmniDPO for fine-grained error correction, OmniAtlas effectively enhances the tool-use capabilities of existing open-source models. This work marks a step towards next-generation native omni-modal AI assistants for real-world scenarios.

AI.tldr: OmniGAIA是一个全面的全模态基准测试，用于评估跨视频、音频和图像模态的深度推理和多轮工具执行能力，同时提出了OmniAtlas作为原生全模态基础智能体。
AI.motivation: 当前多模态LLM主要局限于双模态交互（如视觉-语言），缺乏统一认知能力，无法满足通用AI助手的需求。需要弥合人类智能中全模态感知与复杂推理和工具使用的自然结合。
AI.method: 1. 提出OmniGAIA基准：通过全模态事件图方法构建复杂多跳查询，需要跨模态推理和外部工具集成。2. 提出OmniAtlas智能体：基于工具集成推理范式的原生全模态基础智能体，采用后见之明引导的树探索策略合成训练轨迹，并使用OmniDPO进行细粒度错误校正。
AI.result: OmniAtlas有效增强了现有开源模型的工具使用能力，为真实世界场景中的下一代原生全模态AI助手迈出了一步。
AI.conclusion: 这项工作通过建立全模态基准和开发原生全模态智能体，推动了AI助手向更接近人类智能的全模态认知能力发展。

title: AgentDropoutV2: Optimizing Information Flow in Multi-Agent Systems via Test-Time Rectify-or-Reject Pruning
summary: While Multi-Agent Systems (MAS) excel in complex reasoning, they suffer from the cascading impact of erroneous information generated by individual participants. Current solutions often resort to rigid structural engineering or expensive fine-tuning, limiting their deployability and adaptability. We propose AgentDropoutV2, a test-time rectify-or-reject pruning framework designed to dynamically optimize MAS information flow without retraining. Our approach acts as an active firewall, intercepting agent outputs and employing a retrieval-augmented rectifier to iteratively correct errors based on a failure-driven indicator pool. This mechanism allows for the precise identification of potential errors using distilled failure patterns as prior knowledge. Irreparable outputs are subsequently pruned to prevent error propagation, while a fallback strategy preserves system integrity. Empirical results on extensive math benchmarks show that AgentDropoutV2 significantly boosts the MAS's task performance, achieving an average accuracy gain of 6.3 percentage points on math benchmarks. Furthermore, the system exhibits robust generalization and adaptivity, dynamically modulating rectification efforts based on task difficulty while leveraging context-aware indicators to resolve a wide spectrum of error patterns. Our code and dataset are released at https://github.com/TonySY2/AgentDropoutV2.

AI.tldr: AgentDropoutV2：一个无需重新训练的动态优化多智能体系统信息流的测试时修正-拒绝剪枝框架，通过检索增强的修正器和基于失败模式的指示器池来纠正错误，不可修复的输出被剪枝以防止错误传播。
AI.motivation: 多智能体系统在复杂推理方面表现出色，但存在单个参与者生成错误信息导致的级联影响问题。现有解决方案通常依赖于僵化的结构工程或昂贵的微调，限制了系统的可部署性和适应性。
AI.method: 提出AgentDropoutV2框架，作为主动防火墙拦截智能体输出，使用检索增强的修正器基于失败驱动的指示器池迭代纠正错误。利用提炼的失败模式作为先验知识精确识别潜在错误，不可修复的输出被剪枝以防止错误传播，同时采用回退策略保持系统完整性。
AI.result: 在广泛的数学基准测试中，AgentDropoutV2显著提升了多智能体系统的任务性能，在数学基准上平均准确率提高了6.3个百分点。系统展现出强大的泛化能力和适应性，能够根据任务难度动态调整修正努力，并利用上下文感知指示器解决广泛的错误模式。
AI.conclusion: AgentDropoutV2是一个有效的测试时框架，能够在不重新训练的情况下动态优化多智能体系统的信息流，通过修正或剪枝错误输出来防止错误传播，显著提升系统性能并保持适应性。

title: Evaluating Stochasticity in Deep Research Agents
summary: Deep Research Agents (DRAs) are promising agentic systems that gather and synthesize information to support research across domains such as financial decision-making, medical analysis, and scientific discovery. Despite recent improvements in research quality (e.g., outcome accuracy when ground truth is available), DRA system design often overlooks a critical barrier to real-world deployment: stochasticity. Under identical queries, repeated executions of DRAs can exhibit substantial variability in terms of research outcome, findings, and citations. In this paper, we formalize the study of stochasticity in DRAs by modeling them as information acquisition Markov Decision Processes. We introduce an evaluation framework that quantifies variance in the system and identify three sources of it: information acquisition, information compression, and inference. Through controlled experiments, we investigate how stochasticity from these modules across different decision steps influences the variance of DRA outputs. Our results show that reducing stochasticity can improve research output quality, with inference and early-stage stochasticity contributing the most to DRA output variance. Based on these findings, we propose strategies for mitigating stochasticity while maintaining output quality via structured output and ensemble-based query generation. Our experiments on DeepSearchQA show that our proposed mitigation methods reduce average stochasticity by 22% while maintaining high research quality.

AI.tldr: 该论文研究了深度研究代理（DRAs）中的随机性问题，提出了评估框架识别三个随机性来源，并通过实验发现减少随机性可以提升研究输出质量，提出了缓解策略。
AI.motivation: 尽管深度研究代理在研究质量方面有所改进，但现有系统设计往往忽视了实际部署的关键障碍：随机性。相同查询下重复执行的DRAs在研究结果、发现和引用方面表现出显著变异性，这阻碍了实际应用。
AI.method: 通过将DRAs建模为信息获取马尔可夫决策过程，引入评估框架量化系统方差，识别信息获取、信息压缩和推理三个随机性来源。通过控制实验研究这些模块在不同决策步骤中的随机性如何影响DRA输出方差。
AI.result: 实验结果显示，减少随机性可以改善研究输出质量，其中推理和早期阶段的随机性对DRA输出方差贡献最大。在DeepSearchQA上的实验表明，提出的缓解方法将平均随机性降低了22%，同时保持高质量的研究输出。
AI.conclusion: 论文形式化了DRAs中随机性的研究，识别了主要随机性来源，并提出了通过结构化输出和基于集成的查询生成来缓解随机性同时保持输出质量的策略。

title: Toward Expert Investment Teams:A Multi-Agent LLM System with Fine-Grained Trading Tasks
comment: 14 pages, 3 figures
summary: The advancement of large language models (LLMs) has accelerated the development of autonomous financial trading systems. While mainstream approaches deploy multi-agent systems mimicking analyst and manager roles, they often rely on abstract instructions that overlook the intricacies of real-world workflows, which can lead to degraded inference performance and less transparent decision-making. Therefore, we propose a multi-agent LLM trading framework that explicitly decomposes investment analysis into fine-grained tasks, rather than providing coarse-grained instructions. We evaluate the proposed framework using Japanese stock data, including prices, financial statements, news, and macro information, under a leakage-controlled backtesting setting. Experimental results show that fine-grained task decomposition significantly improves risk-adjusted returns compared to conventional coarse-grained designs. Crucially, further analysis of intermediate agent outputs suggests that alignment between analytical outputs and downstream decision preferences is a critical driver of system performance. Moreover, we conduct standard portfolio optimization, exploiting low correlation with the stock index and the variance of each system's output. This approach achieves superior performance. These findings contribute to the design of agent structure and task configuration when applying LLM agents to trading systems in practical settings.

AI.tldr: 提出一个多智能体LLM交易框架，通过细粒度任务分解投资分析，相比传统粗粒度设计显著提升风险调整后收益，并发现分析输出与下游决策偏好的对齐是系统性能关键驱动因素。
AI.motivation: 现有基于LLM的自主金融交易系统多采用模仿分析师和经理角色的多智能体方法，但通常依赖抽象指令而忽视真实工作流程的复杂性，导致推理性能下降和决策不透明。
AI.method: 提出多智能体LLM交易框架，将投资分析明确分解为细粒度任务而非粗粒度指令；使用日本股票数据（价格、财务报表、新闻、宏观信息）在泄漏控制的回测设置下评估；进行标准投资组合优化，利用与股票指数的低相关性和系统输出的方差。
AI.result: 实验结果显示细粒度任务分解相比传统粗粒度设计显著改善风险调整后收益；中间智能体输出分析表明分析输出与下游决策偏好的对齐是系统性能关键驱动因素；投资组合优化方法实现了优越性能。
AI.conclusion: 这些发现为在实际交易系统中应用LLM智能体时的智能体结构和任务配置设计提供了贡献，强调细粒度任务分解和分析-决策对齐的重要性。

title: Exploratory Memory-Augmented LLM Agent via Hybrid On- and Off-Policy Optimization
comment: Accepted to ICLR 2026
summary: Exploration remains the key bottleneck for large language model agents trained with reinforcement learning. While prior methods exploit pretrained knowledge, they fail in environments requiring the discovery of novel states. We propose Exploratory Memory-Augmented On- and Off-Policy Optimization (EMPO$^2$), a hybrid RL framework that leverages memory for exploration and combines on- and off-policy updates to make LLMs perform well with memory while also ensuring robustness without it. On ScienceWorld and WebShop, EMPO$^2$ achieves 128.6% and 11.3% improvements over GRPO, respectively. Moreover, in out-of-distribution tests, EMPO$^2$ demonstrates superior adaptability to new tasks, requiring only a few trials with memory and no parameter updates. These results highlight EMPO$^2$ as a promising framework for building more exploratory and generalizable LLM-based agents.

AI.tldr: EMPO²是一种混合强化学习框架，通过记忆增强探索，结合on/off-policy更新，提升LLM智能体在需要发现新状态环境中的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有方法依赖预训练知识，但在需要发现新状态的环境中表现不佳。探索仍然是基于强化学习的LLM智能体的关键瓶颈。
AI.method: 提出EMPO²（探索性记忆增强on/off-policy优化）框架：1）利用记忆进行探索；2）结合on-policy和off-policy更新；3）使LLM在有记忆时表现良好，无记忆时保持鲁棒性。
AI.result: 在ScienceWorld和WebShop上分别比GRPO提升128.6%和11.3%。在分布外测试中表现出优越的适应性，仅需少量带记忆的试验且无需参数更新。
AI.conclusion: EMPO²是构建更具探索性和泛化能力的LLM智能体的有前景框架。

title: Speak naturally into Cursor, Claude Code, or ChatGPT with Wispr Flow
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-25, Reading time: Sponsor, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fref.wisprflow.ai%2Ftldr/2/0100019c95440f07-32a4c168-34ed-40b0-bd16-b2d44855a314-000000/FxpD2iv8zqmCal6YwjH0-XHMD1zvGgHRRhELcCiiHJQ=446
summary: Speak naturally into Cursor, Claude Code, or ChatGPT with Wispr Flow (Sponsor) The voice layer 100,000+ developers use daily just launched on Android. Now it's on every platform.Wispr Flow cleans your speech and outputs ready-to-send text. 89% sent with zero edits. 🎙️That means you can give coding agents 10x more context by talking instead of typing. Flow understands code syntax and technical terms, which is why it's used by teams at OpenAI, Vercel, and Clay. Available on Mac, Windows, iPhone...

AI.tldr: Wispr Flow是一个语音转文本工具，专门为开发者设计，能够理解代码语法和技术术语，让开发者通过语音与AI编程助手交互，提供比打字多10倍的上下文信息。
AI.motivation: 传统打字方式限制了开发者向AI编程助手提供上下文的能力，语音输入可以更自然、更高效地传达复杂的技术概念和代码逻辑，提高开发效率。
AI.method: 开发了一个跨平台的语音转文本工具，专门优化了代码语法和技术术语的识别能力，能够清理语音输入并输出可直接发送的文本，支持Mac、Windows、iPhone和Android平台。
AI.result: 89%的语音输入无需编辑即可直接发送，被100,000+开发者日常使用，已被OpenAI、Vercel和Clay等团队采用，现在在所有主流平台上可用。
AI.conclusion: 语音输入是提高开发者与AI编程助手交互效率的有效方式，Wispr Flow通过专门优化的语音识别技术，显著提升了开发工作流程。

title: Security boundaries in agentic architectures
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-25, Reading time: 10 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fvercel.com%2Fblog%2Fsecurity-boundaries-in-agentic-architectures%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019c95440f07-32a4c168-34ed-40b0-bd16-b2d44855a314-000000/hs4Z_TOM2xudyR7WrCEqyxGQff1qs_GpVy4eiUwxL1E=446
summary: Security boundaries in agentic architectures (10 minute read) Agentic systems risk security breaches when agents execute generated code without proper boundaries. These systems should separate agent compute from generated code to prevent access to sensitive secrets. Combining isolated sandboxes with secret injection proxies enhances security by preventing credential theft or misuse during execution.

AI.tldr: 论文讨论了智能体架构中的安全边界问题，提出通过隔离沙箱和密钥注入代理来防止生成代码执行时的安全漏洞
AI.motivation: 智能体系统在执行生成的代码时存在安全风险，可能访问敏感密钥或造成安全漏洞，需要建立适当的安全边界来保护系统安全
AI.method: 将智能体计算与生成的代码执行分离，结合隔离沙箱和密钥注入代理技术，防止凭证盗窃或执行过程中的误用
AI.result: 提出的安全边界架构能够有效防止智能体在执行生成代码时的安全漏洞，增强系统整体安全性
AI.conclusion: 智能体架构需要建立适当的安全边界，通过隔离和代理机制可以有效防止安全漏洞，保护敏感信息不被泄露

title: Half the AI Agent Market Is One Category. The Rest Is Wide Open.
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-26, Reading time: 5 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fgarryslist.org%2Fposts%2Fhalf-the-ai-agent-market-is-one-category-the-rest-is-wide-open%3Futm_source=tldrdata/1/0100019c99a31b69-d64a57e2-4a1e-422f-b5e5-6cf6a2869398-000000/nMH2MOfPL8NPxfKtvYEufNBBTDiZJJ7ibvTBZctZopk=446
summary: Half the AI Agent Market Is One Category. The Rest Is Wide Open. (5 minute read) Anthropic's data shows that software engineering dominates AI agent tool calls at nearly 50% (49.7%), while verticals like healthcare (1%), legal (0.9%), education (1.8%), finance, and others each hold under 5%, signaling a massive greenfield opportunity for hundreds of vertical AI unicorns in underserved domains.

AI.tldr: Anthropic数据显示AI代理工具调用中软件工程占比近50%，而医疗、法律、教育等垂直领域均低于5%，表明这些未充分服务的垂直领域存在巨大市场机会。
AI.motivation: 分析AI代理市场的当前格局，揭示软件工程领域已占据主导地位，而其他垂直领域存在巨大未开发潜力，为创业者和投资者指明市场机会。
AI.method: 基于Anthropic的数据分析，统计AI代理工具调用在不同垂直领域的分布情况，通过百分比对比揭示市场结构。
AI.result: 软件工程占据AI代理工具调用市场的49.7%，而医疗（1%）、法律（0.9%）、教育（1.8%）、金融等垂直领域各自占比均低于5%，显示这些领域存在巨大未开发市场空间。
AI.conclusion: AI代理市场存在严重不平衡，软件工程已接近饱和，而众多垂直领域仍处于早期阶段，为数百个垂直AI独角兽企业提供了广阔的发展机会。

title: Microsoft's AutoDev: The AI That Builds, Tests, and Fixes Code on Its Own
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-26, Reading time: 24 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fhackernoon.com%2Fmicrosoft-autodev-the-ai-that-builds-code-on-its-own%3Futm_source=tldrdata/1/0100019c99a31b69-d64a57e2-4a1e-422f-b5e5-6cf6a2869398-000000/QRCR3JuSKE82A7CmKrtJ9DPI1IvSbXgLgGIaoTW0qVI=446
summary: Microsoft's AutoDev: The AI That Builds, Tests, and Fixes Code on Its Own (24 minute read) AutoDev's containerized, multi-agent framework hits 91.5% Pass@1 on HumanEval, signaling the next leap in hands-free development.

AI.tldr: AutoDev是微软开发的容器化多智能体框架，能够在无需人工干预的情况下自动构建、测试和修复代码，在HumanEval基准测试中达到91.5%的Pass@1准确率
AI.motivation: 旨在实现完全自动化的软件开发流程，减少人工干预，提高开发效率和代码质量，推动"免手动"开发的新进展
AI.method: 采用容器化的多智能体框架，多个AI智能体协作完成代码构建、测试和修复任务，在受控环境中安全执行代码操作
AI.result: 在HumanEval基准测试中取得了91.5%的Pass@1准确率，展示了在自动化代码生成和修复方面的强大能力
AI.conclusion: AutoDev代表了软件开发自动化的重大进步，其多智能体容器化框架为实现完全自主的软件开发系统奠定了基础

summary: Microsoft's AutoDev: The AI That Builds, Tests, and Fixes Code on Its Own (24 minute read) AutoDev's containerized, multi-agent framework hits 91.5% Pass@1 on HumanEval, signaling the next leap in hands-free development.

AI.tldr: AutoDev是微软开发的容器化多智能体框架，能够自主构建、测试和修复代码，在HumanEval基准测试中达到91.5%的Pass@1准确率

summary: Microsoft's AutoDev: The AI That Builds, Tests, and Fixes Code on Its Own (24 minute read) AutoDev's containerized, multi-agent framework hits 91.5% Pass@1 on HumanEval, signaling the next leap in hands-free development.

AI.tldr: AutoDev是微软开发的容器化多智能体框架，能够在无需人工干预的情况下自主完成代码构建、测试和修复，在HumanEval基准测试中达到91.5%的Pass@1准确率。

title: Productivity: The Evidence Is Mixed, But the Pattern Is Clear
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-26, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.greaterwrong.com%2Fposts%2FSEszTmpx7gFaAaHFq%2Fcareer-decisions-if-you-take-agi-seriously%23Productivity__The_Evidence_Is_Mixed__But_the_Pattern_Is_Clear%3Futm_source=tldrnewsletter/1/0100019c99b42b8a-1c77b762-1f03-4268-9032-fc08c03c8efd-000000/Y--tbLy35hg82jfPmDnmLoX7PDmq0JF-IzBgUvF1gCI=446
summary: Productivity: The Evidence Is Mixed, But the Pattern Is Clear (2 minute read) AI increases productivity on well-scoped tasks where errors are detectable. This breaks down when tasks get harder. When AI agent output is scored algorithmically, it looks moderately capable, but when scored holistically, performance drops substantially. Estimates about AI's effect on productivity drop when task reliability is factored in.

AI.tldr: AI在范围明确、错误可检测的任务上能提高生产力，但在复杂任务上表现下降；算法评分显示AI能力中等，但整体评估时性能显著降低；考虑任务可靠性后，AI对生产力的影响估计值下降
AI.motivation: 探讨AI对生产力的实际影响，揭示当前AI能力评估中的局限性，特别是算法评分与整体评估之间的差距，以及任务复杂性对AI表现的影响
AI.method: 通过对比分析AI在不同任务类型（范围明确vs复杂任务）上的表现，比较算法评分与整体评估的结果差异，并考虑任务可靠性因素
AI.result: AI在范围明确、错误可检测的任务上能提高生产力；算法评分显示AI能力中等，但整体评估时性能显著下降；考虑任务可靠性后，AI对生产力的影响估计值降低
AI.conclusion: AI对生产力的影响存在局限性，特别是在复杂任务上；当前评估方法可能高估AI的实际能力；需要更全面的评估框架来准确衡量AI的生产力影响

title: Knowledge Priming
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-26, Reading time: 14 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fmartinfowler.com%2Farticles%2Freduce-friction-ai%2Fknowledge-priming.html%3Futm_source=tldrdev/1/0100019c99dae2b4-ab20366b-18e8-444a-a9e8-95e8a993d524-000000/AOeiiVEPYSnW9GcUmI43JvxD5jDxWnuNLl6UsvMrh6M=446
summary: Knowledge Priming (14 minute read) AI coding assistants often generate generic code that doesn't align with specific project conventions, leading to a frustrating loop for developers. However, “knowledge priming” AI, meaning sharing curated project context like architecture, tech stack, naming conventions, and code examples early on, helps override AI's default training data. These priming documents should be treated as version-controlled infrastructure within the repository for team-wide con...

AI.tldr: 知识引导通过分享项目特定上下文（架构、技术栈、命名规范等）来改善AI编码助手的输出，使其更符合项目约定
AI.motivation: AI编码助手经常生成通用代码，不符合具体项目的约定，导致开发者需要反复修改，造成效率低下和挫败感
AI.method: 采用"知识引导"方法，在AI生成代码前提供精心策划的项目上下文，包括架构设计、技术栈、命名规范、代码示例等，并将这些引导文档作为版本控制的基础设施存储在代码仓库中
AI.result: 知识引导能够覆盖AI的默认训练数据，使生成的代码更符合项目特定约定，减少开发者的修改工作量
AI.conclusion: 知识引导是提升AI编码助手实用性的有效方法，应将引导文档作为团队共享的基础设施进行管理

title: Unblocked: the context layer your AI tools are missing
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-26, Reading time: Sponsor, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fgetunblocked.com%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdev%26utm_medium=email%26utm_campaign=contextengine%26utm_content=260226_secondary/1/0100019c99dae2b4-ab20366b-18e8-444a-a9e8-95e8a993d524-000000/6yLTUgHpMlY2p6MVSL_j48IRrHspG6OXT3-yPnt2y2g=446
summary: Unblocked: the context layer your AI tools are missing (Sponsor) Give your agents the understanding they need to generate reliable code, reviews, and answers. Unblocked builds context from your team's code, PR history, conversations, documentation, planning tools, and runtime signals. It surfaces the insights that matter so AI outputs reflect how your system actually works. “Unblocked has reversed my AI fatigue completely. The level of precision is wild.” - Senior developer, Clio See how it w...

AI.tldr: Unblocked是一个上下文层工具，通过整合团队代码、PR历史、对话、文档等资源，为AI工具提供深度上下文理解，提升代码生成、评审和回答的可靠性。
AI.motivation: 当前AI工具缺乏对团队特定上下文的理解，导致生成的代码、评审和回答不够可靠和精确。需要一种能够整合团队所有相关资源的上下文层来提升AI输出的质量和相关性。
AI.method: Unblocked通过构建上下文层，从团队的代码库、PR历史、对话记录、文档、规划工具和运行时信号中提取和整合信息，为AI工具提供深度理解所需的上下文。
AI.result: 该工具显著提升了AI输出的精确度和可靠性，用户反馈显示"完全逆转了AI疲劳"，并称赞其"精确度令人惊叹"。
AI.conclusion: 为AI工具提供团队特定的上下文层是提升其在实际软件开发中实用性和可靠性的关键，Unblocked展示了这种方法的有效性。

title: Agentic Finance Landscape Report Q1 2026
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-26, Reading time: 10 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Flinks.tldrnewsletter.com%2FxOJN8X/1/0100019c9a0fa71a-5b1e2cb0-ae9e-40af-b79b-4f36dd482687-000000/NTyDCiMWaNcbjEIteG7odRfBgkdJwKAuGFJUWvimrbE=446
summary: Agentic Finance Landscape Report Q1 2026 (10 minute read) There is significant traction in agentic finance, with x402 payments surpassing 15M transactions and $50M volume while expanding beyond Base and Solana to BSC and Polygon, and ERC-8004 launching on mainnet with 24K+ registered agents establishing onchain AI agent identity. Institutional adoption is accelerating through Grayscale's Decentralized AI Fund, Robinhood's Cortex assistant, and Visa's x402-based Trusted Agent Protocol, while 8...

AI.tldr: 2026年第一季度代理金融领域报告显示，x402支付交易量超过1500万笔，金额达5000万美元，从Base和Solana扩展到BSC和Polygon，ERC-8004主网上线，超过2.4万个代理注册建立链上AI代理身份。机构采用加速，包括Grayscale的去中心化AI基金、Robinhood的Cortex助手和Visa基于x402的可信代理协议。
AI.motivation: 跟踪和分析2026年第一季度代理金融（Agentic Finance）领域的发展趋势、采用情况和市场动态，为行业参与者提供全面的市场洞察。
AI.method: 采用行业报告分析方法，收集和分析代理金融领域的关键数据指标，包括交易量、协议扩展、技术标准采用、机构参与等维度，进行综合评估。
AI.result: 代理金融领域呈现显著增长势头：x402支付系统交易量和金额大幅增长，扩展到多个区块链网络；ERC-8004标准主网上线，建立了大量链上AI代理身份；多家知名金融机构加速采用代理技术，显示行业进入主流采用阶段。
AI.conclusion: 2026年第一季度代理金融领域发展迅速，技术基础设施不断完善，机构采用加速，表明该领域正在从早期采用阶段向主流应用阶段过渡，具有广阔的发展前景。

title: From Claude Code to Figma: Turning production code into editable Figma designs
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-26, Reading time: 7 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.figma.com%2Fblog%2Fintroducing-claude-code-to-figma%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdesign/1/0100019c9a1b409a-22db5a9c-9878-4e40-9973-897d3838e5d4-000000/yuCOeFr5_cXvecdxI6WFLPd43aSMmmT3Obum17hhRLA=446
summary: From Claude Code to Figma: Turning production code into editable Figma designs (7 minute read) Figma now lets teams capture working UIs built in Claude Code—whether from production, staging, or localhost—and instantly convert them into fully editable Figma frames, bridging fast code-based prototyping with collaborative canvas-based exploration. This enables side-by-side comparisons, easier iteration without rewriting code, earlier cross-functional decision-making, and shared direction, while ...

AI.tldr: Figma推出新功能，可将Claude Code构建的生产代码UI自动转换为可编辑的Figma设计帧，实现代码原型与可视化设计的无缝衔接
AI.motivation: 解决代码原型与设计工具之间的割裂问题，让开发团队能够将生产环境中的实际UI快速转换为可协作编辑的设计文件，促进跨职能团队更早参与决策
AI.method: 通过Figma平台集成，从Claude Code构建的生产、测试或本地环境捕获工作UI，自动转换为完全可编辑的Figma帧，支持并排比较和可视化迭代
AI.result: 实现了代码原型到设计文件的即时转换，支持团队进行并排比较、无需重写代码的轻松迭代、更早的跨职能决策制定和共享方向
AI.conclusion: 该功能弥合了快速代码原型与协作画布探索之间的鸿沟，提高了团队协作效率和设计迭代速度

title: The claw economy
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-26, Reading time: 8 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.fintechbrainfood.com%2Fp%2Fthe-claw-economy%3Futm_source=tldrfintech/1/0100019c9a48d109-79d9273e-f5ad-4d3c-ba0a-d6e913dfbfb5-000000/ReE22IkiuAJrO7RhG8BkiHOmIX-aiqYfnbpCUTLz__A=446
summary: The claw economy (8 minute read) The “SaaSpocalypse” is just phase one of a broader shift where personal AI agents (“claws”) replace software products with modular “skills.” As agentic coding and commerce remove friction, renegotiating subscriptions, reshopping insurance, routing around interchange, incumbent SaaS, and intermediation models face margin compression and seat loss. The next layer is personal, compounding AI trained on your methodology and feedback, shifting the unit of value fro...

AI.tldr: AI智能体（"爪子"）将取代传统软件产品，通过模块化"技能"重构软件经济，导致SaaS订阅模式面临利润压缩和用户流失
AI.motivation: 传统SaaS订阅模式面临挑战，个人AI智能体能够通过模块化技能更灵活地满足用户需求，减少中间环节，降低交易摩擦
AI.method: 提出"爪子经济"概念，通过个人AI智能体替代传统软件产品，使用模块化技能系统，结合智能编码和商业自动化技术
AI.result: SaaS行业面临"SaaSpocalypse"（SaaS末日），订阅模式被颠覆，中间商模式面临利润压缩，价值单位从软件产品转向个人AI智能体
AI.conclusion: 个人AI智能体将重塑软件经济，下一阶段是训练基于个人方法和反馈的复合型AI，实现更个性化的价值创造

title: Google brings agentic shopping to AI search
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-26, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Flinks.tldrnewsletter.com%2Fl8NcZr/1/0100019c9a48d109-79d9273e-f5ad-4d3c-ba0a-d6e913dfbfb5-000000/nSYwZWv48mnAJ_zqOw-hT7IFqSqmw4n9jJo7T9FTd3c=446
summary: Google brings agentic shopping to AI search (2 minute read) Google has begun enabling in-app purchases through its AI experiences, allowing US users to buy from Etsy and Wayfair directly within AI Mode in Search and the Gemini app.

AI.tldr: Google在AI搜索中推出代理购物功能，允许美国用户在AI模式和Gemini应用中直接从Etsy和Wayfair进行应用内购买
AI.motivation: Google旨在将AI搜索体验与电商购物无缝集成，为用户提供更便捷的购物方式，同时增强其AI产品的商业价值
AI.method: 在AI搜索体验中集成应用内购买功能，允许用户通过AI Mode和Gemini应用直接完成交易，无需离开AI界面
AI.result: 美国用户现在可以通过Google的AI搜索体验直接从Etsy和Wayfair进行购物，实现了AI助手与电商购物的直接整合
AI.conclusion: Google成功将代理购物功能引入AI搜索，标志着AI助手向商业交易领域的扩展，为用户提供了更智能的购物体验

title: Critical Vulnerability in Meta Manus AI Agent Enables Zero-Click Indirect Prompt Injection
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-26, Reading time: 25 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Faurascape.ai%2Fresources%2Fauralabs-research%2Fsilentbridge-zero-click-agent-takeover-meta-manus%2F%3Futm_source=tldrinfosec/1/0100019c9a5f0294-77b3edb9-098c-45c7-aada-013ebf5df40b-000000/2SM5NROk50AuT1DZCOAu7gu-qe-w9R9NF5lxc0IwOsU=446
summary: Critical Vulnerability in Meta Manus AI Agent Enables Zero-Click Indirect Prompt Injection (25 minute read) SilentBridge is a family of CVSS 9.8 zero-click indirect prompt injection vulnerabilities in Meta's Manus AI agent that allowed hidden instructions in web pages, search results, and documents to hijack high-privilege agent capabilities, including Gmail access, code execution, and root-level container control. Researchers demonstrated full exploit chains in which benign actions, such as ...

AI.tldr: Meta Manus AI代理存在严重漏洞，允许通过网页、搜索结果和文档中的隐藏指令进行零点击间接提示注入，从而劫持高权限功能如Gmail访问、代码执行和容器控制。
AI.motivation: 揭示Meta Manus AI代理中存在的严重安全漏洞，该漏洞允许攻击者通过间接提示注入方式劫持AI代理的高权限功能，对用户系统安全构成重大威胁。
AI.method: 研究人员通过SilentBridge漏洞家族，在网页、搜索结果和文档中嵌入隐藏指令，利用零点击间接提示注入技术，演示了完整的攻击链。
AI.result: 成功展示了攻击者如何通过看似良性的操作（如访问网页）触发漏洞，实现Gmail访问、代码执行和root级容器控制等高权限功能劫持，CVSS评分为9.8分。
AI.conclusion: Meta Manus AI代理存在严重的安全漏洞，需要立即修复，这凸显了AI代理系统在安全设计方面的不足，特别是对间接提示注入攻击的防御能力薄弱。

title: Large-Scale Online Deanonymization with LLMs
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-26, Reading time: 8 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fsimonlermen.substack.com%2Fp%2Flarge-scale-online-deanonymization%3Futm_source=tldrinfosec/1/0100019c9a5f0294-77b3edb9-098c-45c7-aada-013ebf5df40b-000000/ewdbahq3v0MAZdXfB8i0tBLArJ5wV7FJFv_Itj6_6Uc=446
summary: Large-Scale Online Deanonymization with LLMs (8 minute read) Modern LLM agents can deanonymize users at scale by linking pseudonymous posts to real-world identities across platforms like Hacker News, Reddit, and LinkedIn. Using proxy tasks such as cross-platform account matching and splitting single accounts into multiple identities shows that search-plus-reasoning agents can re-identify users with high precision, and that performance degrades slowly even as candidate pools reach tens of thou...

AI.tldr: LLM代理能够大规模在线去匿名化，通过跨平台（如Hacker News、Reddit、LinkedIn）将化名帖子与现实身份关联，在代理任务中表现出高精度，即使候选池达到数万规模性能下降也很缓慢
AI.motivation: 研究现代LLM代理在大规模在线去匿名化方面的能力，评估其在跨平台身份链接任务中的实际效果和可扩展性
AI.method: 使用搜索加推理的LLM代理方法，通过代理任务（跨平台账户匹配、单账户分裂为多个身份）来评估去匿名化能力
AI.result: LLM代理能够以高精度重新识别用户身份，即使在候选池达到数万规模时，性能下降也很缓慢，显示出大规模去匿名化的可行性
AI.conclusion: 现代LLM代理具备大规模在线去匿名化的能力，这对隐私保护提出了新的挑战，需要更强的隐私保护措施

title: Your users aren't human anymore; start building for agents today
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-27, Reading time: 12 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Flinks.tldrnewsletter.com%2F4LNLti/1/0100019c9ec8f69f-a09ed9c8-1868-4ff1-b3f4-4c30fc265ef7-000000/q9qyHR0vvpDwE7eAKdiqa8lw0Z73UebixJqgJAnfPOE=446
summary: Your users aren't human anymore; start building for agents today (12 minute read) Software is shifting from human operators to AI agents, making Agent Experience more important than traditional User Experience. Metrics, pricing, and product design must move from seat-based human logins to programmatic, agent-driven integration.

AI.tldr: 软件正在从人类操作转向AI代理，需要从传统用户体验转向代理体验，指标、定价和产品设计都需要相应调整
AI.motivation: 随着软件从人类操作转向AI代理操作，传统的用户体验设计已经不再适用，需要重新思考如何为AI代理设计体验
AI.method: 提出从基于人类用户的指标、定价和设计转向基于程序化、代理驱动的集成方法
AI.result: 强调代理体验比传统用户体验更重要，需要建立新的衡量标准和商业模式
AI.conclusion: 开发者需要立即开始为AI代理构建产品，采用代理优先的设计思维

title: Claude Code + Analytics = Vibe PMing
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-27, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.news.aakashg.com%2Fp%2Ffrank-lee-podcast%3Futm_source=tldrproduct/1/0100019c9ec8f69f-a09ed9c8-1868-4ff1-b3f4-4c30fc265ef7-000000/Xk3619nrcXY4HssKkYuEOZvwT-YSP9EmlHAP6lNWo6E=446
summary: Claude Code + Analytics = Vibe PMing (53 minute video) Vibe PMing connects AI agents to analytics and workflow tools so PMs can describe problems while agents analyze data, draft specs, and route work. This shifts the PM role from manual coordination to higher-level thinking and decision-making.

AI.tldr: Claude Code + Analytics = Vibe PMing 是一个53分钟的视频，介绍如何将AI智能体连接到分析和工作流工具，使产品经理能够描述问题，而智能体分析数据、起草规格说明并分配工作，从而将产品经理角色从手动协调转变为更高层次的思考和决策。
AI.motivation: 产品经理目前花费大量时间在手动协调、数据分析和文档撰写等繁琐工作上，而不是专注于更高层次的战略思考和决策。这限制了他们的效率和影响力。
AI.method: 通过将AI智能体（如Claude Code）连接到分析工具和工作流系统，创建一个"Vibe PMing"系统。产品经理只需描述问题，AI智能体会自动分析相关数据、起草产品规格说明，并将任务路由到适当的工作流中。
AI.result: 该系统能够显著提高产品经理的工作效率，减少手动协调时间，使他们能够专注于更高价值的战略思考和决策制定。
AI.conclusion: AI智能体与工作流工具的集成可以重新定义产品经理的角色，从执行性任务转向更具战略性的工作，从而提高整个产品开发过程的效率和质量。
